website_summaries.verdict: A large and durable sleeping bag that's perfect for camping in even the coldest weather.
pros: Outer shell that's resistant to tears
cons: The inside of the bag has a tendency to stick to your clothing

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke before I even took it camping
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is very warm, as advertised. However- after using it for 1 single winter (not even camping- using it in my bed cause my house has poor insulation) the zipper came off the track. So, I tried to put it back on the track as anybody would- and it broke apart because it is super cheap casted pot metal. So this basically is just a big blanket now, not a sleeping bag that zips up. All they had to do is put a good brass zipper on it, perhaps a YKK made zipper. Wish I would have bought a different bag that would have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: McGee

customer_reviews.title: Huge bag. Warm bag.
customer_reviews.text: I've car camped with this bag for a year now. 29f is the lowest I've used it in. It kept me extremely comfortable. Its huge and I love it. I dont get that trapped feeling because I can turn over without much issue. I've learned wearing smooth pants or long John's helps with the ability to move around easier without fabrics getting caught on each other. We car camp so the size and weight arent really an issue. I bought my husband the smaller bag and he's trying to convince me I actually bought the bigger one for him. I did not.
customer_reviews.author: SVinLV

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Zipper
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. We ordered this sleeping bag for my “Cub Scout Master” husband for Christmas. This weekend was the second time he’s used it on a camping trip with the scouts and the zipper broke. ( See Picture) We are usually very satisfied and happy with our Amazon purchases, but this one is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: missy abernethy

customer_reviews.title: So warm and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a recent trip with high 30/low 40 degree nights and it's very warm and comfortable. I thankfully did not have to test it down to it's survival rating of -25F but I was incredibly warm inside at 40F even without wearing clothes. The only downside to this is that it's bulky. This didn't matter at all to me since I was not hiking with it. I didn't deduct a star for that reason; this is a great sleeping bag for normal camping but it's no replacement for the ultralight bags which cost four times as much. Different products for different uses.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: and very comfortable. This product went beyond my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Quality, reliability, and very comfortable. This product went beyond my expectations, and is a true cold weather bag. It met all of the requirements that it promised, and keeps me warm every night of the week. I drive trucks in the oil fields of North Dakota, and it has been dipping below 0° every night this week. I used this bag the first night that it came, very quickly I might add, and it kept me warm and cozy, even though I could have had the truck running. I shut all the power off in the truck, as a test, and had no chills at all in -5 weather. Excellent product, and I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for a camping trip in the Colorado mountains. Yes it keeps you warm yes they are comfortable but other than that they are a total pain in the rear end! You slip and slide around in them. They twist up very easily! It’s so bulky the zipper constantly gets stuck not to mention bc of the bulkiness and being slippery it is impossible to get them rolled up back in the bag! I literally sat there and used my arms and legs and just shoved section by section into the storage bag!! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Love this huge gnarly beast!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. Durable, warm, huge, and cozy. I compare it to the grizzly from blackpine and both are really nice. I couldn’t find another grizzly, so I bought this for my wife (I have the grizzly). The flannel isn’t super soft but seems more durable than the super soft flannel. The outer shell is more substantial than the grizzly. Make No mistake— these beasts are huge—but that is exactly what I want when it is cold. You will not backpack with this, but that isn’t it’s purpose. I like the zipper in this better than the grizzly, as it doesn’t snag in the fabric quite as easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort bag at cost of space.
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge bag. Very very comfortable but at the cost of space when packing. So take that into consideration when determining what you want out of your bag. If you're wanting to pack light, look elsewhere. If you're packing for comfort, buy it. If this was helpful, I'd appreciate you letting me know.
customer_reviews.author: Dillwidit

customer_reviews.title: Worst sleeping bag I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in May for a snow trip to Yosemite in June. The trip was canceled but I had another trip planned to sequoia in July. Temps dipped to 40 degrees at night. Thank goodness I didn't go on the snow trip because I was freezing in this bag. Extremely disappointed. The lining is not attached so don't try changing positions. The zipper slides with the slightest pull so the only option is to keep it zipped all the way up and Velcro. The return date has passed which isn't fair. Ugh. I will never buy this brand again. Falsely advertised and not worth the purchase price. I really hate this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jess P

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and very nice sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: I went winter camping when it was -31. I was very comfortable in this bag. More than enough room to store my boots in the bag so they wouldn't freeze up. Very warm and very comfortable sleeping bag. Nice compression sack too. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: 1blood

customer_reviews.title: Best night camping I have probably ever had.
customer_reviews.text: My son's Boy Scout troop goes camping every month regardless of the weather. I bought these because I always freeze during the winter camp outs. Anyways, our last camp it wasn't terrible but the temps were in the low teens 13F-15F. I crawled into this bag fell asleep and before I knew it the scouts were up making breakfast. I had slept all night in a deep sleep and couldn't believe how warm and comfortable I was. In fact when I got up and out of the sleeping bag, my body was so warm that I was literally steaming fro the cold air in the tent outside the sleeping bag. Great Sleeping bag for sure!
customer_reviews.author: David Foos

customer_reviews.title: Good quality warm bag
customer_reviews.text: We had previously bought one of these at a local sporting goods store for $25 more. These are high-quality bags, and do well in colder temperatures unlike the stuff you will find on the shelves at most department stores. This one arrived in perfect condition, no damage or flaws, and has already been used a few times. I would buy this bag over and over again if needed. The inner material is soft and comfortable. The drawstring allows you to cinch up the neck for warmth. It has an elongated area for your head. And the rectangular bottom is much more comfortable than the constricting mummy bags.
customer_reviews.author: RideUtah

customer_reviews.title: Bulky Bag and Misleading Description
customer_reviews.text: This bag was a major disappointment for me; after seeing positive reviews I was very excited for a decent bag at this pricepoint. The bag is very large even when compressed and could not be taken on even an overnight camping trip due to its 9+lb weight. I wish I had noticed this earlier when purchasing the product. The bag is certainly warm but is not a four-season bag as described. It is also very difficult to get it back in the compression sack; overall very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Zipper constantly gets stuck.
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is excellent for keeping me warm if you can get the zipper to work. One problem is that it is super slippery and constantly slides off my air mattress. While that’s doable what isn’t doable is the zipper constantly gets material stuck in it making it very, almost impossible to zip which makes it not very warm. I would not purchase this again and will not be using it after this camping trip. The 2 stars is because it is a warm sleeping bag when the zipper works, other than that, I wouldn’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Size different from product specs
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when I rolled out this sleeping bag on the floor and measured the width. The product description stated it is 36" wide. Not so. This bag measured 33". Also, I personally felt that the bag was harder to roll-up than any of the previous sleeping bags I have owned. To compress it adequately, you must fold it into thirds. This may sound picky, but since the outer material is so slick, it was tough to keep it tightly rolled up. I imagine this is true with many other brands, but why should it much extra time? Otherwise, the bag seemed very comfortable. I'm 6' 1" and I had plenty of room down below. I did return it.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Elder

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag! ...... Don't be fooled and instead buy one of those supposedly hi tech ultralight pack sleeping bags, those bags aren't nearly as warm and you can feel the ground in those bags with no insulation under you and you might survive -25 but you won't be happy that night. ......This sleeping bag is actually warm at seriously cold temperatures and might weigh a couple more pounds, but it's worth packing in:) a good night sleep brings happiness, 3 or 4 more pounds to pack in doesn't hurt half as much as waking up every hour because you are cold....
customer_reviews.author: somebody

customer_reviews.title: This is great sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: Ok seriously folks, I’m don’t write reviews until I’ve tested each product over time. I do this for y’all benefit. I hope you do the same. With that said, this sleeping bag is awesome!!! There is an arctic blast going on at this time. I’m traveling in my van and using this sleeping bag at night with temps at 20degrees F. I’m toasty warm. No kidding. Love the drawstrings. They seriously help. Great quality. So there you have it. A review that’s been tested true. Enjoy. I recommend and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag, but definitely not a light weight
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be a well made sleeping bag, comfortable, with a very nice quality stuff bag. But be ready for the re-stuffing to take a bit of effort. But definitely can do. NOW, it is not a light weight bag, and I'm sure most would want something a bit lighter for back packing. Unless you have a hefty back pack, and a strong back and body that doesn't mind the extra weight. For me this is a more ideal sleeping bag for car camping, which is what I bought it for. So I am happy with this purchase. So far, with my limited use, I find it to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm, super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is so comfortable and warm. Took it out on a very cold and rainy outing. Have not slept better in months. It comes with a compression bag, which is nice. The flannel lining is super comfortable. The shape allows for a lot of room to move around. Draw strings around the top and the "mummy" head part ensure that the cold air stays out and the warm air stays in. Been airing it out after the trip, but am loath to put it away because it is So comfortable to take a nap in!
customer_reviews.author: SciPub

customer_reviews.title: Warm and toasty sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: My first below zero bag. Used it for a late fall camping trip in Colorado mountains, nice and warm even my toes, which is how I am basing my review. Outside night temps 27°, in a tent laying on a self inflating mat. I'm 5'11 tall medium build plenty of room!
customer_reviews.author: turbo yoda's

customer_reviews.title: Nice for car camping!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this sleeping bag. It's very comfy (fluffy) and good for colder weather. It is quite a bit warmer than my 0 deg. I've taken it camping several times already but i still can't tell you the level of comfort for a specific degree as i have a heater i use also. From handling it and sleeping in it I believe it would keep me warm in 30+ temps. My only major gripe, which is the same for most sleeping bags is it's a little tough to put back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: MountainWalker

customer_reviews.title: So warm!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! I hate being cold, especially while I sleep. I had one terrible experience camping and it soured me for a whole year. This changed the game though. We were camping near Mt Hood in Oregon in July but it still got into the 30s at night. I actually woke up to take layers off I was so warm! For me, that’s a fine problem to have! Just like all the other reviews say, it’s a big, thick sleeping bag and wouldn’t be good for backpacking. I’m 5’9 and had plenty of room in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie H

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! Posting four stars as I haven't used this outdoors yet but my concern was what the quality of craftsmanship would be and if I'd fit in it...6' 4" 230. I'm pleased to say the craftsmanship is excellent. Fluffing it it really holds air. I totally fit head to toe and the zipper (another peave) works well while in it. The stuff sack is also of good quality. The price was fair and it comes with a lifetime warranty. What's not to love? I think I'm going to like this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Qtrhorsebreeder

customer_reviews.title: If youre doing camping in winter u need this
customer_reviews.text: Best sleeping bag we’ve bought. Scouts had to do a winter camp this past weekend and my son wasnt cold at all. We usually buy $30-$40 coleman bags that say theyre for winter camping but it theyre not warm enough. Will buy again. My husband used it and he’s 6’3”. Says its the warmest he’s been at night when camping. It is really a lot bigger and a little heavier than i imagined so probably not for a backpacking trip.
customer_reviews.author: teikiri

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sleeping bags - super warm, soft, and practical for camping or anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Warm and very good quality. Like that you can zip together a right sided zipper bag with a left sided zipper bag (this is what we got) so kids/family can snuggle into one pair of bags together. Only downside is that I received one sleeping bag that was not the color I ordered, so it mismatched the other bag we got...but that was ok..the bags are such good quality and the colors are all pretty, so I didnt mind. Also I like the packing bag that you put your sleeping bag into - very handy - you can pack it down into a tiny size to transport with you.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag, Low Cost
customer_reviews.text: This bag worked better than I expected! I bought it and used it the same weekend on a last minute camping trip in the Rockies of Colorado above 10000 feet. The temp dropped to about 24 degrees and I didn't get cold once. In fact I had to open it up for a little bit because I was too warm. This bag is also huge. I'm a big guy and it fit me with no issues. I would highly recommend this bag to anyone looking for a quality, low cost sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Archuleta

customer_reviews.title: Happy With Purchase - Bags Zip Together Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I was really nervous about buying these because of all the negative comments about the sleeping bags not zipping together properly, but mine fit together perfectly!! I bought two XL sleeping bags, one with a Right zipper, the other with a Left zipper. The bags are super fluffy and comfy. When zipped together, the zipper opens up in the middle. For me, one of the worse things about sleeping bags is packing them back up in their bags. You do not have to roll these bags!! Just shove them back in the bag. It was pretty easy. Can't wait to try these out on our next camping trip!
customer_reviews.author: freddycrew

customer_reviews.title: Please read...this is very poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Used once, washed, nylon liner has tears and filling coming out. If I still had the packaging I would return and purchase another brand. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Booklover65

customer_reviews.title: Quality product that will for sure last many years to come
customer_reviews.text: Everyone woke up at the campsite talking about how cold the night was right before I said that I woke up a few times sweating inside of this thing. We have 3 coleman 0 degree mummy bags and they're great too but you get no space to move your legs. Sure this is a little heavier than those mummy bags but way better in my opinion for comfort. Im sure even a tall person fits inside with no problem because I'm 5'9" and I dissappeared inside of it LOL. Warm, comfortable and looks to be very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Warmest Sleeping Bag I Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: This bag is the warmest sleeping bag I have ever had. I am 6'3". 230 lbs. and it has loads of room. I have gas and electric heat in my camper but have never used it because I am always so warm in this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bag I could use for a week and leave behind. This bag said left open, it is left zip if you are laying on your back. It also says zero degree, I call BS on that. I slept from 40 to 65 degrees and was perfectly comfy never sweating. I would not trust it below 20... It has a quality feel and I like the extra head pillow area. It fit back in the stuff sack easily. I was surprised I could see daylight through it, making it hard to sleep late.
customer_reviews.author: T Bone

customer_reviews.title: Poofy and warm.
customer_reviews.text: This is one poofy sleeping bag. Not for hikers, but good for glampers. I got the -25 blue option. I used it in the uper teens to low 20's. It was definitely warm and comfortable. I can see it definitely keeping me warm down to zero degrees. I'm not sure about -25, but I don't remember it ever getting that cold around were I live, so I don't know if I will ever be able to test that out. Overall I can see this keeping me plenty warm and cozy in the winter months. I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: IB WebN

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for COLD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go camp on the ice fishing. Sure enough NEGATIVE 4 degrees first night! Slept very well! Had to remove my socks I was so warm ( I did have a buddy heater). The zipper was a little tricky to zip up to my neck due to the bulk of the insulation on the bag, but it was warm!!! It is somewhat large when rolled up and a touch difficult to get back in it’s nice bag, but well worth the warmth!
customer_reviews.author: DTube

customer_reviews.title: Does not fully unzip
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could say more about this sleeping bag. We never did put it to use because we were looking for the versatility of being able to use the bag as a quilt. Unfortunately, the zipper stops at the side and doesn't even give you that option. We ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: DON'T PURCHASE! FALSE ADVERTISING REGARDING SIZE
customer_reviews.text: One star is to much. This bag states it's 90 x 36. It's maybe 84 x 33 at best if you stretch it out a lot. I was looking for a large bag and this is a letdown. Should have read more reviews. My bad. I even gave them the benefit of the doubt and had a replacement sent. It too is only 84 x 33. Returned both. If you are a larger person and expecting this to accommodate your size based on their dimensions, run away. Not much more to say as I didn't even use it because the thing is too small!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful mistake
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this by mistake and boy oh boy, was that a lucky mistake! You could put two people in it. And, while I don't plan on winter camping, it was fine for me at a Washington state beach camp in August. It took two of us to remove it from the stuff sack, and, as a lady of a certain age, I didn't try more than once to put it back! My adult son managed it however, and on trips without strong younger hands I'll just roll it up and plop it into the trunk. Don't regret the purchase one bit!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Crone

customer_reviews.title: Warm but bulky and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Super warm. Super fluffy. Pretty heavy. Won't recommend for use in situations where you have to carry this bag long distances. I would recommend this for car campers or for those who want a warm and happy sleeping bag for winter camping and weight and size don't matter.
customer_reviews.author: allenlid

customer_reviews.title: More of a tip really
customer_reviews.text: More of a tip really. I rolled the bag up without folding it long ways and wrapped 3 compression/lashing straps around it to keep it rolled. I unzipped the separator between the sleeping bag compartment of a 75L ruck to make one 75L compartment. Stuffed the sleeping bag long ways into the ruck and packed my tent, bushcraft chair, extra clothes and other gear around it.
customer_reviews.author: East Kentucky Bushwacker

customer_reviews.title: Literally a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a lifesaver and is everything they say it is. My son was sleeping in his car during winter in Salt Lake City. Temperatures in the -15. He said he got the best night sleep ever. now that he's in an apartment he still keeps it in his car for winter emergencies. They say to hand wash but they wash wonderfully in a giant washer at the laundromat. He had no problem washing or drying it
customer_reviews.author: Nonie O

customer_reviews.title: and they work great! Love them
customer_reviews.text: Got a matching set for the wife and I to use in western CO camping around 9-10000 feet, and they work great! Love them. Construction seems fine, I was worried about the reviews going on about the bad zippers, IMHO they're comparable to any other mid-range sleeping bag zipper. If you try to break it, I'm sure they'll break.
customer_reviews.author: J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Just dang fantastic and wonderfully warm.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome just awesome! First time in my life I've ever found a sleeping bag that was as warm as it claimed and the stuff bag makes rebagging ridiculously simple! Between the buffer edges and Velcro zipper holders this is probably the most well thought out sleeping bag I've ever seen. Not only would I buy it again but I'm already planning on ordering a few more in different weights!
customer_reviews.author: David Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfy!!
customer_reviews.text: Super sleeping bag! Haven't used it outside yet, but am looking forward to it! My son used it in our cold basement and was very comfy. He said he can't wait to use it on his next Trail Life camping trip! Love the fact you don't have to "roll" the sleeping bag to fit it into the pouch...you just STUFF it in the bag that comes with it! Sooooo....much easier! Bag is a little on the heavier side due to it's temp. rating, so I wouldn't want to hike it in or out of anywhere...but I will get mummy bags for those trips. Money well spent! Will keep everyone posted after the upcoming Trail Life camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wittmuss

customer_reviews.title: BIG, HEAVY, WARM
customer_reviews.text: Ok.. This bad boy is a beast. It weighs 5 lbs, will never fit in any brand of back pack, and will never ever fit back into the compression sack it came in. But if you are looking for a decent priced great sleeping bad with room that will keep you warm. THIS IS THE ONE. Teton is a reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: You need these!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Im not an experienced camper but they kept me toasty, yet they weigh nothing and pack easily. Just start shoving in the compression pack and done. The straps tighten it all up. Also love that you can zip them together and cuddle up. Quality seems great and inside isnt traditional “fleece” which i hate, but soft without being silky and cozy.
customer_reviews.author: Baker Girl

customer_reviews.title: but with no heater all night I'm assuming it got pretty low. Also
customer_reviews.text: I used it in my trailer on a night it snowed outside and I purposely did not run the heater all night to see how it worked. I had to hang one leg out of the bag because I was too warm at times. Granted, I was inside and I don't know what the temp got down to in the trailer...but with no heater all night I'm assuming it got pretty low. Also, it seems a little bigger than most bags and I liked the extra room.
customer_reviews.author: wine country

customer_reviews.title: Warm and conformable!
customer_reviews.text: This is so warm and conformable! Perfect for car camping because it's heavy but it's very conformable. For the price Ive not found anything close to this good! Maybe not quite a 0degree bag but 100x better than most all of the 15 or 20 degree bags out there.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of being constrained in a mummy bag and figured I'd give this one a shot. Its very spacious (I'm 6'0'', 205 lb) and comfortable. Absolutely no issues keeping toasty at night with temps in the high 20's, sleeping on an insulated pad. The head area design and extra baffles are great too. For backpacking, its probably too bulky and heavy, but for car camping this thing is great!
customer_reviews.author: bmor

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Warm!!
customer_reviews.text: Took these camping in Grand Teton and Dinosaur National Monument,, Utah. Nighttime temperatures were down in the 30's. Wow - were they warm! Everyone unzipped them and slept directly on their sleeping mats using them as duvets. OK, they are pretty big and a little heavy but we were car camping so no problem for us. They take a little to get back in the bag but its not too bad, just need to fold in half longways and roll up really tight. I got someone to help get the bag over. They seem very well made and zippers work very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: jeremyg998

customer_reviews.title: BE SURE TO ORDER OPPOSITE ZIPPERS!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are incredible sleeping bags and my husband and I slept great camping in the cold! They were super roomy, warm, and easy to pack and carry. The only problem was I didn't realize I hadn't ordered opposite zipping zippers and so we ended up with the hood covering one of our faces (lol!). Luckily it's been remedied and exchanged but hopefully other people buying these as a pair will see this review and double check their order!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Quality, warm, beware the crapshoot if trying to get 2 to zip together.
customer_reviews.text: This is a warm bag. The inside is comfortable, the outside slightly slick. I haven't tried it at -25 degrees (!) - but it seems warm. Appears to be quality materials and construction. As other reviewers have noted, if you want 2 to zip together, that may or may not work - as they have to come from the same batch!
customer_reviews.author: Dave in NC

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: These bags are very comfy. I have the 0 degree and it is warm as well. The left and right zip don’t line up great but it was close enough we didn’t bother needing to exchange them. This is where I started my journey with TETON gear. With a lifetime warranty and great customer service I’m all in on the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Adam LoFaso

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry wide bag
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy and a bit closter phobic. I like to be warm but also stay comfortable and dry. My other bag was always getting damp in the morning. This can be but just shakes off if I hit the side of the tent at night. It is warm amd allows me to stretch my legs out and roll over. It has a flap near the top that keeps your body heat in and is easy to zip up while in it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan DurigTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Nice for 6'3"/210lbs, compresses to 12x17 in compression sack provided.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this bag and want to leave a preliminary comment. I'm 6'3", 210 and hate mummy bags. It's long enough and plush inside. It comes with a stuff sack. I packed and unpacked it a couple of times and found I could get it to 12 inches in diameter and 17 inches long, or a boxier 14x13 if I leaned on it differently. I packed it into a large-sized ALPS Mountaineering Compression Sleeping Bag Stuff Sack for comparison, and got it into an 11x16 configuration.
customer_reviews.author: D. Abrahamson

customer_reviews.title: Runs short, which is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would run a little short based on other reviews-- there's no -25 version of the regular size, but I don't need 90" long. This measures just over 80" long and about 33" wide, which is perfect. Lining feels nice and comes with a solid compression sack. Looking forward to testing this boy out in some winter camping!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Still love it!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a sleeping bag for a while but this one is really toasty and my daughter and I can snuggle in it if we want to. The fleece is soft and one of my favorite color combinations. Sturdy zippers and waterproof outer layer definitely says quality.
customer_reviews.author: Belali

customer_reviews.title: Cozy sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: i love how cozy and warm this sleeping bag is and i like that it comes with a bag to store it in. I will say it is hard to get the sleeping bag into the storage bag nicely and neatly. perhaps i just need more experience with that but i tend to use the sleeping bag less because it's not easy to put away.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Parker

customer_reviews.title: Works good if it fits your needs.
customer_reviews.text: For the price and for my needs, I don't think I could've found anything better. As long as you don't need it to be light or super compact, this should work great for you. I got this for camping in my truck bed camper, so I don't have to carry it in a bag or anything like that. I also got a second one to zip together to make one large one for my wife to come along too!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: It's comfortable, plenty big for me (6'3"
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 7 day Colorado elk hunt. It's comfortable, plenty big for me (6'3", 145lbs), and most importantly kept me very warm in 20 degree weather. The bag is fairly big when rolled up. I wouldn't recommend it for hiking/backpacking, but if you're packing in with a vehicle or horse it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, the exterior makes it slide around.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 14-year old son to get him something he could grow into. He said that overall he liked it but the outer shell was slick and it tended to slide around a lot. He also noted cold spots that I attribute to his smaller size (since this is a long bag) and not being used to rectangular bags. His first weekend using this bag was cold (never got much over freezing) and they had snow overnight and it kept him plenty warm.
customer_reviews.author: DGBradley

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Used it to camp out in 45-50F degree weather. Was cold all night and hardly slept. Bag is supposed to be rated down to 20F. Not even close. Also, the inside of this bag 'sticks' to clothing so that whenever you roll over the bag becomes turned/tangled. NO good for side-sleepers. Wish I hadn't purchased this item.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: "Bag" this bag!!
customer_reviews.text: Very warm; good thing. Zippers don't work well or easily. It is very difficult to enter/exit. These are bad things. Area for the human head should be re-engineered so it would not make a difference how one tried to enter the bag...big issue for me. Because of these practical problems, this sleeping bag does NOT get used as often as it should. I am disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I love the sleeping bag so far. I wash it when I first got it and dried it in the dryer and no issues whatsoever. It seems like quality material very nice and soft and thick. Can’t wait to test it out soon on a chilly night in a tent. So far great product.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.text: It’s supposed to keep you warm till 0 degree....I woke up freezing at 36 degree
customer_reviews.author: doina bratis

customer_reviews.title: This sleeping bag is great. Very comfortable and soft
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is great. Very comfortable and soft. The only issue i had with it, is that it slides around a lot on my sleeping pad. The material is kind of slippery so when i turn inside of it the inside drags a bit too much apart from the outer layer.. and i kept having to rearrange the material, and keep pulling things back in place. Other than that it is very nice and warm (I used it in the summer, and it was definitely too warm for summer weather, would probably be good into early fall).
customer_reviews.author: Cicmic

customer_reviews.title: but it looks like I acquired one with a defect
customer_reviews.text: I brought this with me on my trip to Canada and the first time using it the zipper fell off. I have sent multiple messages and haven't received a response yet. It's a warm sleeping bag, but it looks like I acquired one with a defect.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love sleeping with this
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable but just so you realize that it is also super bulky! I would not recommend this for backpacking any distance greater than half a kilometer. But throw it in the back of your car SUV or pick-up truck, and you got bed!
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've used this in a tent into the ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've used this in a tent into the high 30f range. It's almost too warm for that. I've had to unzip it to cool off. That's fine with me, it's easier to cool off than warm up. Is it light? No Is it made of the highest quality moisture shedding materials? No. It's a very bulky very warm sleeping bag that won't break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First Real Camping Experience
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag kept me so very warm in my tent. I had this and a small air mattress (couldn't do the ground thing) and I was warm and comfy. My other friends complained of cold but I was just fine!!
customer_reviews.author: RBM

customer_reviews.title: Warm comfortable roomy!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I took this on our annual winter camping trip and it was perfect. I tent camp with no heater. The temperatures were down to 10 degrees. I was extremely warm using this sleeping bag. At one point, I woke up with ice on the outside of the sleeping bag it was still super warm and waterproof. The XL Celsius Is big and roomy, not restricting on your feet like other mummy sleeping bags. I am having a issue with the zipper staying closed. I am hoping that gets fixed.
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for staying warm on cold nights!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! I bought this for a cold weather camping trip with my son and Boy Scout troop. Our first night out, temps dropped well into the teens. I was so warm after being in the bag for about 15 or 20 minutes, I was able to layer-off down to my thermals. There was a lot of room in th bag for me to move around (6’3” 207 LBS). The only downside to the bag is that its heavy and bulky so if you’re hiking in to your campsite this bag is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far I have been in five degree temperature and this evening bag kept me nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! So far I have been in five degree temperature and this evening bag kept me nice and warm! I am 6ft 2in tall and the extra length has worked out great along with the extra wide compared to other sleeping bags. At that price I think I will by another one!
customer_reviews.author: MARK KENNEDY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag for the mummy bag hater.
customer_reviews.text: Huge bag and very thick, can't wait to test it out this weekend. Looking at a low temp of 10 degrees Fahrenheit.it is not easy to pack it away in the stuff sack, but you can't really expect it to be with it's size.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Skaggs

customer_reviews.title: So roomy and warm! I toss and turn at ...
customer_reviews.text: So roomy and warm! I toss and turn at night so having a roomier bag made a huge difference in the quality of sleep I got with this versus my old bag, in which I would wake up every time I felt the need to turn over. Will eventually get the corresponding bag for my husband so we can zip the two together.
customer_reviews.author: C. George

customer_reviews.title: I need room (stupid amounts of room)...
customer_reviews.text: I have a big belly and I am "wide" sleeper. One knee out, feet not together, butterfly arms... basically like a chalk outline on a crime show. 5'10" 215LBS (SUPER BALD ;). I should have bought the biggest size. Its really warm though and length wise it has zero issues. sacrifice the extra 1/2 lb and buy the XXL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for Buck, Zipper Slides Too Easily
customer_reviews.text: I got to test this bag for the first time on a four day hunt with night temperatures in the 30's. Overall the bag was very comfortable, and when the temps increased after a couple nights, leaving the bag open solved any overheating problems. The biggest problem I had with the bag was the zipper is extremely easy to slide. The zipper moved anytime I moved any part of my body. My plan is to Google solutions for keeping the zipper in place, maybe something like wax. Otherwise, it's a great bag for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Dreams my giant
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this wonderful bag to sleep in. He is 6 foot 5 inches and fits perfectly in it. I no longer have to listen to him complain about not fitting in his sleeping bag. No more cold shoulders for this tall man. Good color and packs easy back into its bag. I have not washed it yet but it does not smell after 3 days of camping so thats a good thing. When it smells bad Ill wash it which seems easy enough and the fabric feels like it will wash easily.
customer_reviews.author: M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: very heavy ,(warm) sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to finally find a sleeping bag equivalent to the one that was stolen years ago. I have not actually used it yet, I am waiting for the cold weather to test it outdoors. How ever it seems to be equal to my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best sleep sack in the market
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a truck driver, so he sleeps in his truck almost every night. He needed something to keep him warm during winter time when outside is -15f. This is the best sleep sack in the market. I definitely recommend it. Easy to wash, very warm and has enough room to move during the night while sleeping. Just perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina.R.

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I thought
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping. The one problem I had was that its much bigger than I thought in terms of the storage space. I thought It was going to be smaller. So I have to tie it on the outside of my bag. But it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Big and toasty.
customer_reviews.text: Took this bag on a 3 week hunting trip into the mountains of Montana. We didn't set up our wood stove until the second day. We woke up to 20 degrees inside the tent. I had frost on the outside of my sleeping bag, but was warm and toasty inside. Lots of room inside the bag. It's a big bag so I wouldn't use it for backpacking. But for a cold weather Camp, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SDTator

customer_reviews.title: I could not be more pleased. Weight wasn't an issue since I wasn't going ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for an early spring river trip. I could not be more pleased. Weight wasn't an issue since I wasn't going to be backpacking. I wanted a bag roomier than a mummy bag, warm and comfortable. This bag is enormous! I am 5'7" - it was like being in a bed. I could flop around, lay on my side, jackknife my legs and always was incredibly comfortable. I slept through the night, never cramped, never got cold, never woke up twisted in a mummy bag. The bag is well made, durable, super-comfortable and warm. I'm not sure it will be toasty at -25° but it is toasty in the 30's.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Pope

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pack but so warm
customer_reviews.text: This is THE ONE for extremely cold weathers. It’s so fluffy, warm and comfortable. - star: it took 3 people to fold and stuff it back into the carrying bag. It’s large so expect it to take up a lot of room in the car for your camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: aromatichaze

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I replaced some cheap department store sleeping bags with these. Great choice! We go camping in Colorado and I was getting sooo cold at night. These sleeping bags are very soft and warm. The do not seem to be lined with flannel as the listing states but the fabric is very comfortable. We bought two XLs and both my husband (6’1”) and I (5’1”) fit comfortably inside our bags. If you do not need a super compact bag, and want to get a wonderful night’s sleep in fairly cool weather, I would recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Warm, heavy, durable. Not a backpacker bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a bag for car camping or packing on a snowmachine. It’s heavy. But toasty warm. I used it car camping on a spring fishing trip in Southcentral Alaska. 35 deg nights with a breeze coming off the water. I stayed warm.
customer_reviews.author: Chymarra

customer_reviews.title: Massive Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knowing it was large, I did not realize it was SO large - it's a massive bag that takes up a lot of trunk space and cupboard space (and is heavy). If space is not tight then it's great. It's warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very warm! I don't know whether it works for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very warm! I don't know whether it works for 0F though... But it kept me quite warm on a Spring night! Compared with those products in REI, this sleeping bag worths every penny!
customer_reviews.author: jelly

customer_reviews.title: We use these in the RV and love them
customer_reviews.text: Well if he’s really warm made really well and we love them
customer_reviews.author: ladonna

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable *****
customer_reviews.text: So for this bag is amazing Haven’t tested anything below 28° though Well update when I do It is big but worth It (if you like being warm when u sleep). Honestly though I’d rather sleep in this then in my bed lol Teton is the sh** UPDATE***** 03/13/20 So its about a year and a half later and I've tested this bag out multiple times at temperatures around -10 to -15 I've never been uncomfortable in this bag. One of my favorite product.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Good car camping bag for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sleeping bag for frigid below freezing weather. Bought for a late season Colorado elk hunt. Very roomy and good option for bigger individuals. Kept me warm on several close to or below 0 nights. Definitely NOT a backpacking bag, even in its factory packaged state it is pretty bulky and heavy, but if you’re staying close to your vehicle you’d be happy with it. A bit difficult to get it back into its compression bags, but eventually got it back in and close to original dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: CoPatrick

customer_reviews.title: NICE AND WARM
customer_reviews.text: We used these bags in weather to about 50 degrees, and they were a bit too warm, which is what we expected. I think they would be more than adequate to 40 degrees. Seem to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: christine jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Warm
customer_reviews.text: I probably didn’t need the XL, bought it anyway. After using it for 3 weeks on a Colorado vacation, I’m glad I did. I camped at close to 10,000 feet. Night temps dropped to as low as 27 degrees. I stayed perfectly warm. The only complaint I have is that it is hard to resack alone. That is due to it’ s abundant insulation. I solved that issue with a tote. I’ll trade that any day for being comfy and warm. I recommend this bag for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Rave wood

customer_reviews.title: Way too short.
customer_reviews.text: Liking extra length, I bought the XL. I am only 5'5 and my feet stretch against the bottom. I also do not like that you cannot unzip the bottom. It also has an unpleasant odor. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Charity Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sleeping Bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent sleeping bag! I used it with a twin size really tall aero bed over thanksgiving, and for the first time being on an aero bed I wasn't freezing! If it's the winter months, aero beds allow cold air to gather up under you, and there's just not enough insulation between you and the air to keep you from getting cold. I use to pile up blankets, and I would still get cold. This however, saved the day and I was cozy warm. I would suggest that this would work quite well on a cold floor or ground and would live up to its ratings in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Rango

customer_reviews.title: Happy  I got this.
customer_reviews.text: Very warm. Happy I got this. Pretty much making a difficult winter bearable. Item designed in USA manufactured in China (not complaining, just saying). I was able to sleep in my T-shirt & briefs in 23° weather. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Romano

customer_reviews.title: Over all its super comfy and I will be using it for plenty ...
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag came in just in time for me to couch surf at my friend’s apartment for a month. I slept on the floor with sofa cushions as my mattress and the sleeping bag on top. It is so warm in fact that at times I had to stick out my feet to not sweat too much during the night. Over all its super comfy and I will be using it for plenty more couch surfing adventures. I have not used this sleeping bag outdoors so I would not yet know how it would perform in that environment.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for temps 22 to 27 degrees. I have no experience yet for below yet. Very comfortable. Only problem is very difficult to get it back in compression bag. I think I may have to come up with an alternative method of packing.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: One of the warmest bags I've owned!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great!!!!!! I've used it in temps down into the single digits and have been toasty warm. The brushed flannel liner is oddly cozy which I didn't expect. Not a bag you are going to be using for backpacking or walk in camping because this bag is huge even when it's in the compression bag that comes with it, no issue for me since I car camp and the warmth this bag provides makes up for its size.
customer_reviews.author: mathew d.

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bags
customer_reviews.text: Very nice roomy sleeping bag. I bought 4 new sleeping bags for a Colorado elk hunt every one that used a teton bag was very comfortable. The larger sizes are great for us larger folks.
customer_reviews.author: ricke

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! A+
customer_reviews.text: Only negative is it's size. Otherwise I have slept in this in a truck in the middle of winter in CO on vacay (like 10 below) & was sweating!! I am usually a cold sleeper too. A+!! Very comfortable, very warm! I am a cheapo, so was skeptical, but this was worth every penny! Life saver!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: So warm and soft
customer_reviews.text: We used this in the summer in the mountains and it got so hot that he ended up sleeping on top of it. Love how cuddly and soft it is. Also it zipped together with a smaller size which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Janaye Steadman

product_meta.title: TETON Sports Celsius XL Sleeping Bag; Great for Family Camping; Free Compression Sack
product_meta.description: When you need a great sleeping bag to come back to after a long day on the trail, choose the Celsius XL Sleeping Bag, by TETON Sports. This three-to-four-season sleeping bag was built to last a lifetime. It’s filled with innovative fiber fill that keeps you warm and is rated to below freezing temperatures. The mummy-style hood can cinch in around your head for additional warmth and keeps your pillow clean. Its durable shell will stand up to years of rigorous adventures. It’s a warm, comfortable sleeping bag that’s soft to the touch, but don’t take our word for it—read the reviews! The Celsius XL is keeping thousands of car campers happy in The Great Outdoors.
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE SLEEPING BAG FOR ADULTS: Soft lining; Half-circle mummy style hood keeps you warm and your pillow clean; Unzips at the top or bottom for easy access and ventilation; For camping in all seasons
NEVER ROLL YOUR SLEEPING BAG AGAIN: TETON provides a great compression sack for stuffing your sleeping bag; Start at the bottom and stuff the bag in, then tighten the heavy-duty straps
STAY WARM IN COLD WEATHER: You’ll be warm and rested in this sleeping bag; Innovative fiber fill, double-layer construction and draft tubes work together to keep the warmth in
SLEEP WARM: Fluff your sleeping bag and use a camp pad to sleep warmer; Hang loops for long-term storage to maintain maximum loft
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
